concept.title: Alarm Panel

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Details for configuring and operating the alarm panel including event display, acknowledgement, and logging.

othermeta.name: usecase
othermeta.content: guide operators to configure and respond to alarms on the alarm panel

conbody.p: The alarm panel has 24 LEDs that are used for standard indications and selectable options.Not all LEDs are used in all system types or configurations.

sectiondiv.p: When an alarm is activated in the system the corresponding LED is activated on the alarm panel. The status of the LED indicates what alarm is the newest and if the alarms are unconfirmed or confirmed.
Unconfirmed alarm will not be cleared even if the alarm is not active in the system anymore. Only confirmed alarms will be cleared when they are no longer present in the system.
To mute the audible alarm, press the Mute key.

Press the C key one time to:
Confirm any unconfirmed alarms. The LED will stay on but stop flashing.
Clear any confirmed and unconfirmed alarms that are resolved. The LED will extinguish.
Mute the audible alarm (if not already muted).
The fast flashing LED (the first unconfirmed alarm) will stay the same after pressing the C key only once.

Press the C key a second time to:
Confirm the newest unconfirmed alarm. The LED will stay on but stop flashing.
Clear any confirmed and unconfirmed alarms that are resolved. The LED will extinguish.

sectiondiv.note: For a more details and troubleshooting see chapter .

entry.p: The rectifier mains is unavailable or out of tolerance. For tolerances see the technical data The technical data for the system can be found in the manufacturing record book and depends on customer specification..
Rectifier failure Will not be active if the current limiter is active or if the alarm for rectifier mains fault is active.
The DC output is too low, the rectifier cannot synchronize or the rectifier is overheated.

The inverter will turn off because the DC voltage is out of tolerance. For tolerances see the technical data The technical data for the system can be found in the manufacturing record book and depends on customer specification..
Rectifier fuse blown This alarm depends on configuration and might not be present.
The system is in battery operation and the battery is supplying the load.
The inverter is supplied by the batteries in the external DC UPS system.
The battery voltage is below the set DC low alarm level.
The DC voltage is below the set DC low alarm level.
The battery is disconnected from the system.

The DC earth fault current (positive or negative) for the battery is outside the alarm level. For tolerances see the technical data The technical data for the system can be found in the manufacturing record book and depends on customer specification..
The inverter output is out of tolerance or the inverter is overheated.
The inverter or bypass is overloaded.
One or more inverter fuses are blown.
The inverter is not synchronized to the bypass mains.

The bypass mains is out of tolerance measured at the input of static switch EN. For tolerances see the technical data The technical data for the system can be found in the manufacturing record book and depends on customer specification..
For 2-position manual bypass switches: The manual bypass switch is the Bypass position.
For 3-position manual bypass switches: The manual bypass switch is the Bypass or Test position.

The input to the static switch EN is out of tolerance or the static switch EN is overheated. For tolerances see the technical data The technical data for the system can be found in the manufacturing record book and depends on customer specification..

The input to the static switch EA is out of tolerance or the static switch EA is overheated. For tolerances see the technical data The technical data for the system can be found in the manufacturing record book and depends on customer specification..

One or more of the following parts are overheated:
Rectifier bridge
Rectifier transformer
DC choke
Power module
Inverter transformer
AC choke
Static switch EN
Static switch EA
One or more fans are inoperable.
The output is out of tolerance or one of the inputs (rectifier, bypass or DC) are missing for at least one of the internal power supplies (+5 V / ±12 V / +20 V).
At least one of the parallel cables have lost communication.

The rectifier mains is unavailable or out of tolerance. For tolerances see the technical data The technical data for the system can be found in the manufacturing record book and depends on customer specification..
The rectifier voltage is out of tolerance, but the rectifier mains is within tolerance and the current limiter is not active.
The DC voltage is below the set low DC/DC Vaux level. For alarm level settings see the technical data.
The rectifier output fuse is blown.
The rectifier output exceeds the current limit. For limit setting see the technical data.
The units in a redundant system are not sharing the load equally.
The battery voltage is below the set DC low alarm level.
The battery is disconnected from the system.

The DC earth fault current (positive or negative) for the battery is outside the alarm level. For tolerances see the technical data The technical data for the system can be found in the manufacturing record book and depends on customer specification..
One or more of the internal power supplies (+5 V / ±15 V) are unavailable or out of tolerance.

One or more of the following parts are overheated:
Rectifier bridge
Rectifier transformer
Blocking diode
DC choke
One or more fans are inoperable.

sectiondiv.p:
The four LEDs (U), (V), (X), (Y)
(Q), (R), (S), (T) are used for optional alarms. A selection of some optional alarms is shown in the table. Refer to the specific system Drawings for any selected optional alarms.
sectiondiv.note: Additional optional alarms are available on request.

entry.p: Q003 open This alarm is optional and might and might not be present.
Rectifier output switch Q003 is open and the rectifier output is disconnected from the battery and the inverter. The rectifier will turn off.
Inverter input switch Q020 is open and the inverter is disconnected from the rectifier and battery DC input power. The alarm “Inverter fuse blown” will activate.
Inverter output switch Q030 is open and the inverter is disconnected from the load.
Distribution input Q100 is open and the system output is disconnected from the inverter and the battery.
One or more of the feeders Q101-Q1xx have tripped because of an overload or a short-circuit.
One or more of the feeders Q101-Q1xx have been manually opened or have tripped because of an overload or a short-circuit.
An earth fault on the AC output is detected. The isolation resistance to the earth on one or more of the outputs are below the alarm level.
Rectifier output switch Q003 is open and the rectifier output is disconnected from the output.
Distribution input Q100 is open and the system output is disconnected from the rectifier and the battery.
The DC voltage is above the upper alarm level. For level value see the technical data.
The DC voltage is below the lower alarm level. For level value see the technical data.
The output voltage of the voltage dropper is out of tolerance. For tolerance levels see the technical data.
One or more fans in the voltage dropper cubicle are inoperable.
One or more of the feeders Q101-Q1xx are tripped because of an overload or a short-circuit.
One or more of the feeders Q101-Q1xx are manually opened or tripped because of an overload or a short-circuit.
An earth fault on the DC output is detected. The isolation resistance to the earth on one or more of the outputs are below the alarm level.

sectiondiv.p: The four LEDs (U), (V), (X), (Y) are used for programmable relays on the relay board (K013-K016). The programmable options are shown in table. Refer to the specific system Drawings if any programmable options are used.

entry.p: The float voltage is reduced by a set amount.
The total current limitation is changed to the battery current limitation level.
The internal clock is set to a default time, used for synchronization.
Indicates the status of the output couple breaker. Only available for redundant systems with individual batteries.
